ygData.subject: RE: Mez and stun
ygData.msgSnippet: arg, should have read all the way up.  Sorry for my double post  ;) ... From: Baelish [mailto:eq@baelish.aust.com] Sent: Monday, February 28, 2000 12:36 AM To:
ygData.messageBody:
arg, should have read all the way up. Sorry for my double post ;)

-----Original Message-----
From: Baelish [mailto:eq@...]
Sent: Monday, February 28, 2000 12:36 AM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Mez and stun


From: "Baelish" <eq@...>

Mez spells have a fixed duration. Cha only effects the secondary saving
throw on the initial resist.

Charm spells are based to an extent on charisma. If the monster succeeds on
a primary save throw during a charm, then a second roll is done. This
second roll is largely charisma based, and hence a higher charisma will
increase the chance of a longer charm.

Baelish
The Casters Realm
www.castersrealm.com

From: "Ana and Ayl" <2playeq@...>

> > Does anybody have information about the lengths of the mez and stun
lines
> ?
> > I heard in-game that mez is 15 sec, enthrall 30, entrance 45 and dazzle
> 60.
> > The enchanter spell list on Baelish's site says mez 30, enthrall 30,

measure
> > with a stopwatch ?
> >
> > Also, as far as I can tell, this line of spells is fixed duration, i.e,

> > does not get any saving throws to break early like the root line. True ?
> >
> > Stun line : Color Flux 3 sec, Color Shift 7 sec, Color Skew 8 sec. Is
the
> > stun duration fixed ? In my experience, some MOBs seem to be more
> susceptible
> > to staying stunned longer. Like lizards in CT seemed to stay stunned
> forever
> > with even flux.
> >
> > Mohini,
> > Lvl 27 enchanter on Fenin Ro.
